p: The antifungal activity against six commonly occurring plant-pathogenic fungi Alternaria alternata, Cochliobolus heterostrophus, Gaeumannomyces graminis, Glomerella cingulata, Mucor hiemalis, and Thielaviopsis basicola of compounds 364– 365 were evaluated. Compounds 364 and 365 showed selective antifungal activity against Mucor hiemalis with minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) values of 8 µg/mL and 4 µg/mL, respectively. Prochloraz was used as positive control with MIC value of 8 µg/mL against Mucor hiemalis [ 118].
